translation.en: -[woman] What are you eating? -[girl] Guess.
-[woman] I can't guess. -[girl in sing-song] Bet you can.
translation.ko: - 맞혀 봐 - 모르겠어 - 알걸 - 힌트 좀 줘

translation.en: -[woman] How can I guess? -[girl] What day is it today?
translation.ko: - 알걸 - 힌트 좀 줘 - 오늘 무슨 요일이게? - 월요일

translation.en: [woman] Uh, it's Monday.
Oh. Sunday night's pizza night. -You're eating leftover pizza. -[girl giggles]
translation.ko: 일요일 밤엔 피자니까 남은 피자 먹겠구나

translation.en: Hey, make Dad go pick you out a pumpkin. It's that time of year again.
translation.ko: 아빠한테 호박 사러 나가자고 해 벌써 핼러윈이라 집집마다 사놨더라

translation.en: -They're all over. -[buzzer rings]
-[girl] Okay. -[woman] All right.
-Let me talk to Daddy. -[boy on intercom] Delivery.
-[girl] Daddy! -[buzzing] Daddy!
-[man] Hey, Slugger. -[woman] Hey.
[man] Tell me something good. -[woman] Something good.
-[woman] You were right about 101. -[man] How's that?
[woman] But who moves in after a one-day paint job?
[man] Well, you said it was in good shape.
[woman] I wish you were here.
-[man] Who does that help, saying that? -[woman] I can beat myself up if I want.
translation.ko: - 그런 말이 무슨 도움이 돼? - 신세 한탄도 못 해?

translation.en: [man] Go for it. It's just an audience of one.
translation.ko: 해도 되는데 혼자 하란 얘기야, 난 빼줘

translation.en: I'm not playing.
[woman] Tell me to go outside.
[man] Why not make today the day you go outside?
So, what's the latest on the street?
translation.ko: 요새 동네 소식은 뭐 좀 있어요?

translation.en: What happened with the barking dog?
I thought we were going to talk about medications.
We'll get there.
Would you like to take a seat?
Did it get squared away?
The dog?
I guess they started bringing him inside.
Did you end up calling 311? [chuckles] Oh, David talked me out of it.
It's more of a bother for him anyway. It's louder downstairs.
translation.ko: 아래층에선 더 시끄러워서 많이 성가실 텐데…

translation.en: So, I… must have talked to somebody.
Peaceful resolution.
This is the second session that you've done this.
Ask about the neighborhood?
Does that make you uncomfortable?
I just don't know what you're goin' for.
How's the prayer group?
[woman sighs] They're getting by.
[man] Do you think they know you're watching?
translation.ko: 당신이 보고 있다는 걸 이웃들도 알까요?

translation.en: Is this really what you wanna talk about?
What about 101?
Looks like they already moved in. What'd they pay?
Five-five. They were asking for six.
Who are they? The Russells.
Alistair and Jane. The broker says they're from Boston.
translation.ko: 앨리스터와 제인, 부동산 중개인 얘기로는 보스턴에서 왔대요

translation.en: Where's the money from?
She says he's a banker.
But there's practically nothing about them online.
I'm sure you'll figure it out.
What the fuck, Karl?
Curiosity is evidence of a decreased depression pattern.
People who snoop on their neighbors don't kill themselves? [chuckles]
translation.ko: 옆집 훔쳐보는 사람은 자살 안 한대요?

translation.en: Let's try this.
People who attempt suicide lose the right to joke about it.
translation.ko: 자살을 시도하는 사람은 자살로 농담할 자격 없다

translation.en: I have a review with Dr. Kenner this week.
Seeing as I've been unable to get you out the front door for the last 10 months,
she's gonna wonder about the source of my optimism.
translation.ko: 제 낙관의 근거가 뭔지 궁금해할 거예요

translation.en: Let's talk about the Elevan.
Now that you've curtailed the drinking, how are you feeling about the side effects?
[man] I think you're reading into it.
[woman] I've been a shrink for 15 years. I know a threat when I hear one.
translation.ko: 나도 15년 차 정신과 의사야 위협은 구분할 줄 알아

translation.en: [man] He's on your side, Slugger. He's the reason you're still here.
translation.ko: 그분은 당신 편이야 그분 덕분에 살아있는 거야

translation.en: [woman] It's not really therapy if there's a knife at your back.
[man] He comes every week, rain or shine. He's been there all the way through.
translation.ko: 비가 오나 눈이 오나 매주 오시잖아, 성실한 분이야

translation.en: [woman] No, he's getting off on controlling me.
-[man] Really? -[woman] Yes. Did you read about Elevan?
translation.ko: - 진심이야? - 그래 엘리밴이란 약 부작용이 뭔지나 알아?

translation.en: Take a look at the side effects.
[man] I know you're not supposed to drink on it.
[woman chuckles] They always say that.
Shit.
Yes?
[boy over speaker] I live, um, across the street there.
And?
My mom asked me to give you this.
I'm sorry…
I'm not prepared for visitors. [boy] Oh, okay.
Do you have any ideas about what I should do with this?
You can just…
Push the door.
Hi. I'm Ethan. Yes.
Hi. Anna.
I'm from… across the street.
[Anna] Yes.
Sorry, I know you're not having, uh, visitors.
No, I'm… fine. You just surprised me, that's all.
I'm not really a visitor so much. I'm kind of, uh, more like a neighbor.
-I love lavender. -Heh.
My mom asked me to give it to you, like… days ago.
I think that I'm the one supposed to be giving you a gift, eh…
Welcome to the neighborhood.
I like cats' tongues.
Sorry they're not fish fingers, buddy. [chuckles]
He likes you.
No.
How do you like your new house?
I miss the old one.
But we had to leave Boston.
Are those your… people?
Family? Yes.
Are they home?
No, they don't live here. We're separated.
How old is she?
She's eight.
How old are you?
I'm gonna be 16 in six months.
Five months.
What do you do?
Oh, I'm a psychologist. I work with kids.
Really?
Really.
-That's interesting. -Why is that interesting?
I mean, it's more interesting than, like, working at Taco Bell.
-[chuckles] -Why would kids need a psychologist?
You really don't know why a kid would need a psychologist?
No, I mean, I'm sure they do, but I mean, like, why?
Like, why do the kids who see you need a psychologist?
-All sorts of reasons. -School shootings or torturing someone?
translation.ko: 별별 이유가 다 있어 학교 총격이나 괴롭힘 같은 거요?

translation.en: No, it doesn't have to be that dramatic. Some of them are depressed,
translation.ko: 학교 총격이나 괴롭힘 같은 거요? 그렇게 극적인 일이 아니라도 우울증이나 불안증으로 오기도 하고

translation.en: some suffer from anxiety…
some of them are… just having a hard time adjusting to a new place.
translation.ko: 새 학교 적응이 힘들어서 오기도 해

translation.en: I can see your house from my room.
I mean… normally.
Right now, I can see… my dad from your house.
Are you okay?
[Ethan] Yeah.
Are you sure?
No, nothing, I just…
[softly] Hey.
You can talk to me.
I don't know anyone here.
You know me.
Not really.
Well, you could.
Really?
We-we can be friends?
Sure.
Wow. You have a lot of movies.
Too many. That's what my husband says.
I thought you said you guys were separated.
He's still my husband, but you're right.
You're welcome to borrow anything.
Uh… My dad's kind of a tyrant with the TV.
-Goodbye, Punch. -[purrs]
I'm sorry I'm so allergic to you.
Why didn't you say something?
I don't wanna offend him.
He's not that sensitive.
Okay.
Okay, then.
-Enjoy. -Thank you.
See you around? Yeah, see you around.
…in some incredibly rustic community where good manners are unknown…
[man and Anna] …or you suffer from the common feminine delusion
that the mere fact of being a woman
translation.ko: 어떤 무례한 행동도 용인된다는 여성들의 망상에

translation.en: exempts you from the rules of civilized conduct.
translation.ko: 어떤 무례한 행동도 용인된다는 여성들의 망상에 시달리는 모양이군요

translation.en: [Anna] Conduct.
-[man and Anna] Possibly both. -[laughing]
[woman on TV] Possibly. But here's what I wanted to show you…
-[buzzer ringing] -[kids chattering outside]
[man] I'm headed to Brooklyn.
translation.ko: 브루클린 갈 건데 부탁할 거 있어요?

translation.en: -You need me to take care of anything? -Right. Uh, no. Thanks, I'm good.
translation.ko: 브루클린 갈 건데 부탁할 거 있어요? 아, 아니에요, 괜찮아요

translation.en: [man] Sure? Take out the garbage?
-Okay. As long as you're here. -[man] Okay.
You know, David, you've been my tenant for three months.
translation.ko: 데이비드, 세 들어온 지 석 달 됐잖아요

translation.en: You don't have to be so formal.
You can just come in through the basement stairs.
-No, I don't wanna startle ya. -[bottles clinking]
It's dark in here. Do the bulbs need changing?
-I like it dim. -Okay.
Oh, Halloween tonight.
How do we do it without you going outside?
You want me to get some candy?
I'm not going to give out candy.
I'm going to turn the lights out and pretend I'm not home.
translation.ko: 집에 불 끄고 없는 척할 거예요

translation.en: We could just get a bowl of candy and leave it on the porch, like…
translation.ko: 그냥 사탕 그릇 가져다가 현관 앞에 두면…

translation.en: Any kid would take it within a minute and then they'd take the bowl.
translation.ko: 한 명이 다 가져가고 그릇도 가져가겠죠

translation.en: Why don't we get a bowl of apples? 'Cause kids won't take apples.
translation.ko: 그럼 사과를 내놓죠 애들이 안 가져갈 텐데

translation.en: Then what's the point?
Yeah. Okay.
Have a nice time.
Sure. Happy Halloween.
[woman on TV] Let your mind go back to your childhood.
-Was it happy? -[buzzer rings] -Whom did you know in your childhood? -[buzzer rings]
-I can't see by what. -[thud]
-[gasps] -It's no use.
[woman] You lived somewhere. -You had a mother. -[thud] You were loved, you had friends.
translation.ko: 어딘가에 살았고 어머니가 있었죠 사랑받았고 친구도 있었어요

translation.en: [man] Yes.
Get away from my house!
-[kid] Right there! -Hey! -[kid] Get her! -[gasps]
-This is my house. -[kid] Get her!
Hey.
You're gonna have to convince me I don't need to call an ambulance.
[Anna] No, don't do that.
Okay, you know who you are? You know what day it is?
translation.ko: 본인이 누군지 오늘 무슨 날인지 알아요?

translation.en: Yeah, I'm Anna. It's Halloween.
Okay, how many fingers?
[Anna] Three.
Okay. You're all right. You're gonna be all right. Just…
breathing would be good.
I was headed across the street
when those little shits started chucking eggs,
and, oof, you went down hard.
You're Jane Russell.
What makes you say that?
[Anna] Your… your son came by. Ethan.
[Jane] Sit up in case you got a concussion.
-[faucet runs] -[Jane] Jesus, it's dark in here. Do you faint a lot?
I didn't faint.
I mean, it's… like fainting.
-[Jane pours drink] -I can't go outside.
Um… you didn't go outside.
-No, I get panic attacks. -Who doesn't?
Here. Have some of this brandy, please.
Uh, I'm agoraphobic.
I can't go outside.
You're stuck inside this shitty house. Oh. [clicks tongue]
Oh, man. I'd hate to be stuck inside a house this shitty.
translation.ko: 집이 이렇게 형편없으면 갇혀 있기 싫겠네

translation.en: Is that your husband coming home?
It's my tenant.
He lives in the basement.
So, um, what do you do all day? I mean, do you work?
translation.ko: 그럼 하루 종일 뭐 하세요? 일해요?

translation.en: Oh, God, I'm so fucking nosy.
I… I should just go. Um--
-Do you want me to go? -No.
No, it's… It's all right. I'm fine.
I… counsel people.
You counsel people?
-Mm-hmm. -Oh, you're a shrink.
Oh! [chuckles] That's a twist.
You married?
-Separated. -Ah.
And kids?
My daughter Olivia is with her father.
Oh, that's tough.
Yeah.
Yeah. Separated from your kid, that's really tough.
I talk to them every day.
Yeah, it's just… It's--
It's not the same as them being here, though, is it?
Take another drink, please.
-Do you wanna go outside? -You know, I have a shrink of my own.
translation.ko: - 나가고 싶어요? - 담당 정신과 의사 있어요

translation.en: [laughing] Okay. Okay. I get it. I get it.
All right, sorry. That sounds very wise.
translation.ko: 네, 알았어요, 미안해요 - 상담을 받다니 좋은 생각이에요 - 네

translation.en: I get it. [chuckles]
Yeah.
We've been trying to get me to go outside using an umbrella.
I haven't… been able to do it yet.
You will.
You will. You'll figure it out.
[Jane] Notice I'm not asking what made you this way.
[Anna] What way? Agoraphobic.
I have anxiety. I have… an anxiety disorder.
-Punch. [clicking tongue] Punch. -So, um…
That's what all these pills are for?
So, what does… what does this one do? This, uh, pink one.
Uh, that's Inderal.
Ah. Beta blocker. How do you know that?
Um, 'cause it says so on the bottle.
Pretty sure you're not supposed to be… taking these with alcohol.
translation.ko: 술이랑 같이 먹으면 안 될 텐데요

translation.en: Thank you for the candle.
Ethan brought it by. Thanks.
translation.ko: 이선 편에 보내신 거 잘 받았어요

translation.en: Oh. Wow, okay, subject change.
I think I hurt my neck.
-[both chuckle] -He's a nice boy.
-Look. -Oh, what a cutie.
-Yeah. -Yeah. He's my guy. My little baby guy.
You know, when you have a kid, you say, "He's my kid, my guy,"
Like he's yours, like he belongs to you.
-That's not really how it feels. -You belong to them.
translation.ko: 사실 그런 기분은 아니에요 - 내가 아이의 소유인 것 같죠 - 맞아요

translation.en: Right.
translation.ko: - 내가 아이의 소유인 것 같죠 - 맞아요

translation.en: Right. You belong to them. And maybe you never belonged to anybody before.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 내가 애들 소유인 거예요 태어나 처음으로 누구 소유가 되죠

translation.en: I mean, maybe, maybe you thought you belonged to your parents.
translation.ko: 내가 부모 소유였다고 생각하다가 커서 독립하잖아요

translation.en: You grew out of that. You certainly didn't belong to your husband.
translation.ko: 내가 부모 소유였다고 생각하다가 커서 독립하잖아요 남편의 소유도 아니고

translation.en: Then this kid comes along, and he's just got you.
[laughs] I don't have to tell you that.
I like your earrings.
Oh. Oh, thanks, yeah. A gift. They're a gift from an old boyfriend.
translation.ko: 고마워요, 선물이에요 옛날 남자 친구가 준 거였죠

translation.en: Does your husband mind?
I doubt he knows.
He has trust issues.
Oh, why is that?
-Oh, I don't know. -You don't know? Mmm.
No. Come on, no, no. I don't know. I don't know. -No, it's… [clears throat] -Hmm.
[sucks teeth] Who knows why he has them? Um…
He's a good guy, he's a good father. He's just, you know…
-He's tight. -[Anna] Mm. Controlling, and like…
I have my own issues, but I work through them and…
translation.ko: 나도 문제는 있지만 나름 노력 중이고 감당할 수 있어요

translation.en: I can handle them.
translation.ko: 나름 노력 중이고 감당할 수 있어요

translation.en: Maybe sometimes I have to… get in between them and I--
I worry about Ethan, 'cause…
he's sensitive.
Family's… complicated.
Why is your family complicated?
-[Jane] Look. -Oh, wow! That's amazing!
Yeah. Jane Russell original.
-See how I changed the subject on you? -I did.
Yeah, you don't know who you're fooling with.
-[laughter] -[indistinct conversation]
[Anna] Hello?
Uh, it's Alistair Russell. We-we-we we moved in just across the street. 101.
-[buzzer sounds] -[Anna] Push the door.
I… I'm sorry to bother you.
I just wanted to know…
Well, I'm just curious if any of my family has come around to see you this evening.
translation.ko: 저녁에 우리 집에서 누가 왔었나 하고요

translation.en: No.
No, I-- I've been alone.
Okay, thanks.
Sorry to bother you.
Thank your wife.
For the candle. Ethan brought it over.
translation.ko: 부인께 안부 전해주세요 이선 편에 향초를 보내주셨어요 며칠 전에요

translation.en: Days ago.
translation.ko: 이선 편에 향초를 보내주셨어요 며칠 전에요

translation.en: Good.
-[muffled clanging] -[cat yowls]
[dispatcher] 911, what's your emergency?
[Anna] I think there's somebody in my house.
What's your address, ma'am? It's 104, West 121st Street.
-[screams] I'm sorry. -[man] Whoa!
-It's David. -[dispatcher] Ma'am, are you okay?
Yeah, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
-Ma'am? -Yeah, I know him. It's a false alarm. I'm sorry.
I-- I buzzed. I did buzz half an hour ago.
And I cleaned the eggs off your front porch.
What are you looking for?
A guy across the street asked me to help him open some boxes, store some stuff.
translation.ko: 건넛집 아저씨가 상자 좀 뜯어달래요, 짐 정리한다고

translation.en: I thought you might have a box cutter.
I didn't know you were a handyman. I thought you were a singer-songwriter.
Which is why I am a handyman.
You know you've got mold? Yeah, I do.
translation.ko: - 곰팡이 낀 거 알죠? - 네, 알아요

translation.en: David, come back inside!
David?
-Boo! -[gasps]
[David] You're gonna need a pro to seal that roof. It's dangerous.
I'll call somebody.
You okay?
Yes.
Who were you working with across the street?
Russell.
You know him?
How did he find you?
I put up some flyers.
-[screaming continues] -[man shouting]
[Anna] Alistair Russell. West 121st Street.
-[operator on phone] Is this a residence? -Uh, yes.
Press one to have this number texted to you.
Oh, Jesus.
-[Ethan on phone] Uh, hello? -[Anna] Ethan.
It's Anna, across the street.
Is something going on over there? I heard a scream.
No, no. It's fine.
I heard somebody scream. Was it you?
No. [stifles sob]
Are you okay?
[Ethan] He just… It's fine.
-Ethan, do you need-- -[line disconnects]
-Hello? -[Alistair] Yes, you called my number?
translation.ko: - 여보세요? - 네 이 번호로 전화하신 분입니까?

translation.en: Hi, this is Anna Fox from across the street.
Yes?
I… heard somebody scream just now. I wanted to call to check on…
Sorry, you heard what?
-A scream. A scream. -[Alistair panting] Uh, a minute ago.
A scream?
Yeah, from your house.
Sorry, the only people here are me and my boy.
translation.ko: 집에 나랑 애밖에 없는데 비명 안 질렀어요

translation.en: -And we didn't scream. -I heard…
translation.ko: 집에 나랑 애밖에 없는데 비명 안 질렀어요 제가 분명…

translation.en: [on voicemail] This is David, I'm not here right now.
Leave a message and I'll do my best to get back to you.
David?
What's up?
-You hear that scream across the street? -No.
Now. Five minutes ago. I was listening to music.
You didn't hear anybody scream? -I didn't hear anyone scream. -[woman crying]
I'm sorry.
Come in here.
Can I get you something? Something to eat?
No, I'm fine.
Are you?
Ethan, what's going on over there?
He's not a bad guy.
He has a lot of stress. It builds up in him and has to get it out.
-It's all right. -It's not all right.
translation.ko: - 괜찮아요 - 괜찮다는 말 그만 좀 해

translation.en: Stop saying it's all right. It's clearly not all right.
translation.ko: - 괜찮아요 - 괜찮다는 말 그만 좀 해 괜찮은 게 아니야

translation.en: I've gotta go home. I should not have come over.
translation.ko: 집에 갈래요 괜히 왔나 봐요, 죄송해요

translation.en: I'm sorry. I just…
[Anna] No, wait.
[Ethan] I'm sorry. It's okay.
Why are you so nice to me?
Because children need protection.
[sneezes] Sorry. The cat.
I want you to take my number.
Is your mom okay?
[Ethan] Yeah, I… I guess so.
I mean, she has to take his side. [Anna] Okay. Um…
translation.ko: - 엄만 아빠 편을 들어야 하니까요 - 그래

translation.en: All right, look.
Ethan?
Look, Ethan, um, whatever is going on over there…
no matter how bad it gets… this is a safe place.
translation.ko: 일이 얼마나 커지건 여긴 안전한 곳이야

translation.en: You can always come here.
Always. Yeah.
[Anna] You never know what the right thing is to do.
You want to call Children's Protective Services,
translation.ko: "목요일" 아동 보호 센터에 연락해봤자 증거가 없단 말이야

translation.en: it's my word against the father's.
translation.ko: 아동 보호 센터에 연락해봤자 증거가 없단 말이야

translation.en: -[man] Want advice? -[Anna] No.
[man] Don't go look into other people's houses.
[Anna] Karl says curiosity is healthy.
[man] You said he was getting off on controlling you.
[Anna] You said we could talk whenever I wanted to.
[Karl] Everything okay, Anna? [Anna] What's up?
[Karl] You left a message.
-No, I don't think so. -[chuckles]
If I knew how to work my phone I could play it back for you.
translation.ko: 제가 전화만 잘 다루면 녹음 들려드릴 텐데요

translation.en: What are you doing?
[Anna] I'm watching David leave the house.
[Karl] Looks like fun, right?
Looks like he's escaping.
I'm gonna give you another number, Anna.
I don't like the idea of missing your call while we're adjusting these new meds.
translation.ko: 새 약 적응 중인데 연락은 제때 돼야죠

translation.en: [in English] Bitch.
[man on TV] Is that why you visit murder trials?
No. I went because your case was like my father's.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 아버지 사건과 비슷해서 갔던 거예요

translation.en: I know he didn't kill my stepmother.
You've been bad.
It's 9:50. And…
Thanks.
Don't go looking into other people's houses, Punch.
I'm gonna give you some shots that'll freeze your face.
Now, just close your eyes.
-It'll be all right, Vincent. -[Anna gasps] It'll be all right.
Hold your breath, cross your fingers.
Where's my phone?
Where's my phone? Backtrack. Backtrack, backtrack. Keep doing it, keep doing it.
Where are you?
Give him hell, Jane.
[man on TV] Just close your eyes. I've got a fine anesthetic…
[Anna] Where's my phone?
David?
[dispatcher] 911 operator, what's your emergency?
-My neighbor, Jane, she's been stabbed. -Slow down, ma'am.
translation.ko: 이웃집 제인이 칼에 찔렸어요 진정하시고 성함과 주소 말씀하세요

translation.en: What's your name and where are you?
[fumbling] I'm Anna Fox. I'm Anna.
And where are you?
Um, 104, West 121st Street.
That's 121?
121. Yes. Yes.
You say your neighbor was stabbed?
He just turned out the lights.
Where is your neighbor?
She is across the street. And…
-Do you have an address? -Yes.
104, West 124th Street.
Wait, you said "124th Street"?
121st Street!
Help is on the way, ma'am. I need you to calm down.
-Okay. -Are you with your neighbor now?
translation.ko: - 진정하세요 - 네 - 그 이웃분과 함께 계세요? - 건넛집에 있다고

translation.en: She is across the street. I told you that and you are not listening to me!
translation.ko: - 그 이웃분과 함께 계세요? - 건넛집에 있다고 아까 말했잖아요 왜 못 알아들어요!

translation.en: [dispatcher] Anna! Ma'am. Anna, did you stab your neighbor?
translation.ko: 애나! 부인 애나, 본인이 찌르신 건가요?

translation.en: Help me! Help me!
Jane. I'm coming, Jane.
I'm coming, Jane. I'm coming, Jane.
translation.ko: 내가 가요, 제인 내가 가요, 제인

translation.en: I'm coming, Jane. I'm coming, Jane. I'm coming, Jane.
[man] Hello.
Detective Little. NYPD. I was hoping I could ask you some questions.
translation.ko: 뉴욕 경찰서 리틀 형사입니다 몇 가지 여쭙고 싶은데요

translation.en: What are you doing in my house?
I understand you have a tenant downstairs. He home?
I… I don't know.
-That your daughter? -Is she here?
She's with her father. What happened to Jane?
Hi.
-What is this? -Ma'am, you all right?
No, why is he here?
Mr. Russell believes that you made a mistake…
You have never met my wife.
translation.ko: 당신은 내 아내를 만난 적 없어요

translation.en: She helped me one night. We spent the evening together.
translation.ko: 전에 날 도와줘서 저녁에 같이 있었어요

translation.en: No, no. No, I don't think so.
In fact, he came here looking for her.
translation.ko: 이 사람이 제인을 찾으러 이 집에도 왔었어요

translation.en: I was looking for my son, not my wife.
You told me no one had been here.
I lied. We played gin.
-Why would you lie about that? -Why would you lie about that?
I was afraid that you would punish her.
For playing gin? It doesn't matter.
The point is, Dr. Fox, that nothing's happened.
No! I know what I saw!
translation.ko: - 아니에요, 제가 다 봤어요 - 아무 일 없었어요

translation.en: -Nothing's happened to anyone. -No, I was zoomed in with the camera.
translation.ko: - 아니에요, 제가 다 봤어요 - 아무 일 없었어요 카메라로 확대해서 봤어요

translation.en: -Did you take a picture? -I did not!
She's just admitted she's spying on our house.
-Mr. Russell… -Why didn't you take a picture?
translation.ko: - 러셀 씨, 좀… - 왜 안 찍었죠?

translation.en: The important thing is, is that everybody's okay, yeah?
translation.ko: 중요한 건 모두 다 무사하다는 거예요

translation.en: Then where is she?
Where's Jane?
[woman] I'm sorry we haven't met.
I'm Jane Russell.
She's not Jane.
I promise I am.
No, you're not Jane. She's not Jane. I know Jane. Jane's been in my house!
translation.ko: 제인이 아니에요, 제인이 아니에요 제가 알아요, 우리 집에 왔었어요

translation.en: This is absurd.
That's Jane Russell. Get Ethan.
Are you okay, Dr. Fox?
Tell them.
You've never met my mother.
Well, this has been great fun.
See you at the block party.
You made a 911 call yesterday about an intruder in your house?
No.
I mean, yes. But that was a mistake.
It's a criminal offense to make false police reports.
Thank you, Detective.
Am I okay to leave you alone, Dr. Fox?
Look, you need anything, you, um, you call me. Day or night. Hmm?
I have four kids. I don't sleep. [chuckles]
Be well, Dr. Fox.
-[man] Why didn't you take a picture? -[Anna] I was trying to help her.
translation.ko: 사진을 왜 안 찍었어? 빨리 도와줘야지 그럴 정신이 어딨어?

translation.en: Not record it for posterity. Are you doubting me, too?
translation.ko: 빨리 도와줘야지 그럴 정신이 어딨어? - 당신도 의심해? - 난 당신 편이야

translation.en: -[man] I'm on your side. -You don't sound like it.
translation.ko: - 당신도 의심해? - 난 당신 편이야 그렇게 안 들려

translation.en: -Understandable they don't believe you. -[Anna] Because I didn't take a picture?
translation.ko: 경찰이 못 믿는 게 이해는 되잖아 - 사진을 안 찍어서? - 당신이 아프니까

translation.en: [man] Because you're not healthy. And I'm not sure you're getting better.
translation.ko: - 사진을 안 찍어서? - 당신이 아프니까 차도가 있다는 생각이 안 들어

translation.en: [woman] Atkinson, New York.
Hello, I'm trying to reach Alistair Russell.
-[whispers] Jane Russell, Jane Russell… -[on phone] This is Shelly.
Hi, Shelly. I'm trying to reach Alistair Russell
translation.ko: - 셸리입니다 - 안녕하세요 앨리스터 러셀 씨를 찾고 있는데 조앤이 이쪽으로 연락하라던데요

translation.en: and Joan said that I should speak to you.
translation.ko: 앨리스터 러셀 씨를 찾고 있는데 조앤이 이쪽으로 연락하라던데요

translation.en: He doesn't work here.
translation.ko: - 여기서 일 안 해요 - 맨해튼으로 전출되지 않았나요?

translation.en: -I thought he transferred to Manhattan. -Yes, but not with us.
translation.ko: - 여기서 일 안 해요 - 맨해튼으로 전출되지 않았나요? 맞는데 여긴 아니에요

translation.en: Oh, he left Atkinson?
[sighs] You could try calling Boston. I really don't know much about it.
Well, it couldn't have happened very long ago.
You're gonna wanna call Boston.
"My heart is broken forever, but Pam's memorial was brightened
by so many uplifting letters and messages from Atkinson co-workers."
"Thank you, Alistair Russell."
"Thank you, Alistair Russell"?
Pamela Nazin.
"Pamela Nazin, 47, an executive with The Atkinson Group in Boston
translation.ko: '패멀라 네이슨, 47세 앳킨슨 그룹 보스턴 지점의 임원'

translation.en: was found dead early Thursday morning…
…in the parking lot of…"
Steve Runyan. How can I help you?
[Anna] Hi, Steve. My name is Carol,
and I am calling to verify some information on an insurance policy.
-[Steve] Okay. -Are you in human resources?
[Steve] Oh, sorry, not in Boston.
Big company, small office. You'd have to call New York.
translation.ko: 보스턴엔 없어요, 지점이 작거든요 뉴욕에 연락해보세요

translation.en: [Anna] Okay, because they suggested that I, uh, call up there.
[Steve] Who's the employee?
[Anna] It's Inderal.
[Anna] Um, Pamela Nazin.
"Authorities believe Miss Nazin fell from the terrace of her unit
on the sixth floor."
-[gasps softly] -[Steve] Ugh.
[Anna] I'm sorry.
[Steve] No, no, it's cool.
I knew her, so maybe I can help.
translation.ko: 제가 알던 분이라 도움이 될지 몰라요

translation.en: What was her job title?
[Steve] I guess she was an executive assistant.
[Anna] Assistant to whom?
[Steve] Her boss. Alistair Russell.
Is he still with the company?
[Steve] What makes you say that?
I see here I have an address. I know he transferred to Manhattan.
translation.ko: 맨해튼으로 전출 간 건 주소로 알고 있어요

translation.en: [Steve] Yeah.
I know that he moved shortly after Miss Nazin's passing.
[Steve] If you know that, then why are you asking?
[Anna] Oh, I just, um… With files like this, we like to…
We have questions on cause of death. We just--
[Steve] Tell you what. Give me your number, let me call you back?
[Jane] Yeah, that's my guy.
Yeah, you know, when you have a kid, you say, "That's my kid, that's my guy,"
like he's yours…
David?
David?
-What the… -[gasps] What are you doing?
Jesus.
-Um, I was looking for you. -What is that?
-Are you going through my mail? -[Anna] I'm sorry.
translation.ko: 내 우편물 뒤진 거예요? - 미안해요 - 기가 차네

translation.en: -[David] Unreal. -I-- I-- I knocked. I just… I needed to ask you a question.
Ask me what? Huh? Here I am, what's your question?
Jane.
Have you met her? Have you met the woman across the street?
translation.ko: 건넛집 사는 여자 만난 적 있어요?

translation.en: -Jane? -Jane Russell?
-No. -You worked with them.
I worked for him. For Mr. Russell. I never met his wife.
translation.ko: 러셀 씨랑 일했지 부인은 못 봤어요

translation.en: What am I, your messenger now?
Pick up the phone and call him!
Better yet, why don't you take a stroll across the street!
translation.ko: 그냥 전화를 해요 아니면 길 건너서 다녀오든지 싫어요?

translation.en: -No? -[door slams]
You seem really upset.
Why would that be, Anna? Yes, I have a parole problem.
translation.ko: 왜 그러겠어요? 그래요, 나 가석방 중이에요

translation.en: Huh? You wanna read it? Here you go.
-No, it was on the floor. -I'm in violation.
I'm supposed to be in Springfield, Massachusetts.
-Okay. -No, not okay!
It was a bar fight.
I was in the wrong place at the wrong time and I got fucking jumped and I reacted!
translation.ko: 하필 그날 재수가 없어서 어떤 놈이 덤벼들어 싸운 거라고요

translation.en: -God! -[gasps]
I shouldn't have come down here.
Look, I'm working on it.
I'm going to Connecticut to see a guy about it.
translation.ko: 내일 담당자 만나러 오늘 밤 코네티컷에 가요

translation.en: Okay. I'm dealing with it.
Why don't we pretend this never happened?
We're cool, right?
[softly] Yeah.
Just give me a couple of days to get on top of it.
[man] David, come on, let's go!
[David] Man, we need to talk about it.
[woman] I think you know who I am.
Stop watching our house or I'll call the police.
[Anna] Punch?
Punch?
David?
Punch?
Hey! What are you doing down here?
Poor guy, you've been down here all night.
How did you get down here?
[Anna] I like your earrings. Does your husband mind?
translation.ko: 귀고리가 예뻐요 고마워요 옛날 남자 친구가 준 거예요

translation.en: [Jane] I doubt he knows. A gift from an old boyfriend.
translation.ko: 고마워요 옛날 남자 친구가 준 거예요

translation.en: -[man] So now you don't wanna talk. -[Anna] I'm busy.
translation.ko: - 이젠 또 말하기 싫어? - 나 바빠

translation.en: -[man] If I can't say what I think… -[Anna] I'm not delusional.
[man] Break it down. First it's the boy, then that murder across the street.
translation.ko: 잘 생각해 봐 처음엔 건넛집 애 다음엔 살인 사건

translation.en: Now there's another woman in Boston…
an earring, and fucking David, who you always liked.
-[Anna] You done? -[man] With you at the center…
-[Anna] Don't. -…on all those damn pills.
-Fuck off! -[man] There's nothing here for you.
You know it. You've got to move on.
translation.ko: 남들은 못 도와줘, 알잖아 - 당신이 일어서야지 - 못 해

translation.en: [Anna] I don't know, I'm just not made that way.
translation.ko: - 왜? - 나도 몰라, 천성이 그런가 보지

translation.en: I wish to God I could, believe me, but I can't.
translation.ko: 나도 그러고 싶은데 그게 안 돼

translation.en: Everyone else can move on. I can't.
translation.ko: 남들은 다 해도 난 못 해

translation.en: Where's your mother?
Stop it. Stop.
Ethan? Why are you lying to me?
Can't scream at me on the street.
translation.ko: - 다 들리게 소리 지르지 마세요 - 말을 해야 도와주지

translation.en: -I can't help you if you don't tell. -You never met my mother!
translation.ko: - 다 들리게 소리 지르지 마세요 - 말을 해야 도와주지 - 우리 엄마 모르잖아요 - 거짓말하지 마, 다 알면서

translation.en: You were lying and you know it.
translation.ko: - 우리 엄마 모르잖아요 - 거짓말하지 마, 다 알면서

translation.en: -You're just confused. -No, I know what I saw.
You don't. You're just wrong. I know what I saw!
translation.ko: - 잘못 본 거라니까요 - 내가 분명히 봤어

translation.en: -You don't! You're wrong! -We talked about you.
-She told me about you! -Don't do this to me!
Why are you lying for him?!
Ethan. Why are you protecting him?
I can't tell you.
-[yelps] -[Alistair] Go home!
You cannot slap that boy.
I've put up with a lot, Mrs. Fox, all of us have, but this--
translation.ko: 지금까진 참았는데 이건 정말… 적당히 해야지!

translation.en: This stops now.
Your relationship with Ethan, it's inappropriate.
He's a young man! He's a…
translation.ko: 어린애잖아요 겨우 15살 된 애라고요 당신은 중년이고!

translation.en: He's a boy! He's 15-and-a-half and you're a mature woman!
And of course, you're completely out of your goddamn mind!
[nervously] I'll call the police! Go. Go ahead.
Go ahead. I'm sure they'd love hearing from you.
A-- A drunken, shut-in, pill-popping cat lady!
translation.ko: 집구석에 처박혀 고양이랑 사는 약쟁이 술꾼 얘기를!

translation.en: You…
You're fucking with the wrong family.
-Stay away from my son! -[whimpering]
Please!
Hey. You got something in your foot, huh?
-[purring] -You got something in there?
-Punch, what is it? Huh? -[Punch meows]
It's okay.
You don't have any idea who could've sent you this?
translation.ko: 누가 보낸 건지 짐작도 안 되세요?

translation.en: No, the only person who has a key is my tenant, David.
Yeah, where is he? I don't know.
-Are you having problems with David? -No. I mean, no. I…
translation.ko: 데이비드와 문제 있어요? - 아뇨, 그건… - 위엔 아무도 없어요

translation.en: -[Norelli] Nothing up here. -You see, coast is clear.
translation.ko: - 아뇨, 그건… - 위엔 아무도 없어요 보셨죠? 괜찮아요

translation.en: -Can you track the email? -Track it?
-Or trace it? Whatever. -You can't track a Gmail account.
translation.ko: - 추적이든 뭐든 - 지메일 계정은 추적 안 돼요

translation.en: -You could've sent this to yourself. -I'm sleeping.
translation.ko: 본인이 보냈을지도 모르죠 - 자고 있잖아요 - 설정일 수도 있죠

translation.en: -Or you wanted to look asleep. -[Anna] I'm asleep.
translation.ko: - 자고 있잖아요 - 설정일 수도 있죠 잠들었잖아요, 무슨 소리예요?

translation.en: -What the hell? -[buzzer rings]
Dr. Fox, there is no sign that anyone has been here, okay? Nothing is missing.
translation.ko: 박사님, 누가 들어왔던 흔적이 없어요 - 없어진 것도 없고 - 문과 창문도 멀쩡해요

translation.en: -[Norelli] Doors and windows look okay. -Someone has been in my house.
translation.ko: - 없어진 것도 없고 - 문과 창문도 멀쩡해요 누가 우리 집에 들어왔었어요 증거를 줬잖아요

translation.en: -I have given you proof. -[door opens]
translation.ko: 누가 우리 집에 들어왔었어요 증거를 줬잖아요

translation.en: [Alistair] She called my office in Boston!
translation.ko: 보스턴 사무실에 전화를 했어요 알고 있어요?

translation.en: -Did you know that? She's called my house! -[Little] Damn it! Mr. Russell.
translation.ko: 보스턴 사무실에 전화를 했어요 알고 있어요? - 우리 집에도 전화하고 - 진정하세요

translation.en: Why were you fired? -She spies on our house! -All right.
translation.ko: - 왜 해고됐죠? - 우리 집을 카메라로 훔쳐봐요

translation.en: She lured my son into her home! He is abusive.
translation.ko: - 우리 아들까지 꾀어냈다고요 - 이 사람이 애를 학대하고 있어요

translation.en: She is harassing my son. She is harassing my-- He hit his son. I saw him hit his son.
translation.ko: - 내 아들을 추행하고 있어요 - 애 때리는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: She's delusional.
Ethan told me, Jane told me, I saw him do it.
-Um… -She is Jane!
You are a drunk and a drug addict and you made it all up!
You almost had me believing that and then I found this.
What's this? This is a picture that your wife drew and signed.
translation.ko: - 이게 뭐예요? - 당신 아내가 그리고 사인한 그림

translation.en: And you call me delusional, you motherfucker.
-[Norelli] Hey, hey! -It's you.
She was here.
-That proves it. -[Alistair] That doesn't prove anything. That proves you're out of your mind.
What's happening?
Door was open.
-Who are you? -[David] I live downstairs.
It's my tenant. That's David.
-[Norelli] Got a last name, David? -No. Just David. Like Sting.
translation.ko: 성이 뭐죠? 성 없이 데이비드예요, 스팅처럼

translation.en: It's Winters. His last name is Winters.
It's just Winter, actually. Singular.
Where were you last night, Mr. Winters?
In Connecticut. On a job. Why?
Somebody took a photo of Dr. Fox in her sleep…
translation.ko: 새벽 2시쯤 박사님이 잠들었을 때 누가 사진을 찍고

translation.en: around 2:00 a.m. and then e-mailed it to her.
translation.ko: 새벽 2시쯤 박사님이 잠들었을 때 누가 사진을 찍고 이메일로 보냈어요

translation.en: Someone broke in?
How do we know it was last night?
Can anyone confirm you were in Connecticut last night?
translation.ko: 코네티컷에 있던 걸 증명할 사람 있어요?

translation.en: Yeah. The lady I was with.
I'm gonna need her number.
You can call her. Her name is Elizabeth.
Dr. Fox says she saw a woman assaulted in Mr. Russell's house.
translation.ko: 박사님이 러셀 씨 댁에서 폭행당한 여성을 봤다는데

translation.en: You know anything about that?
-No. -Have you ever met Mrs. Russell?
translation.ko: - 아뇨 - 러셀 부인은 만난 적 있어요?

translation.en: No.
Her earring is beside your bed on your nightstand, that little rose.
translation.ko: 제인의 귀고리가 당신 침대 옆에 있어요 장미 모양 귀고리? 제인 러셀의 귀고리예요

translation.en: Jane Russell's earring.
translation.ko: 장미 모양 귀고리? 제인 러셀의 귀고리예요

translation.en: What were you doing in your tenant's bedroom?
She has some serious privacy issues.
Well… how do you do?
That earring belongs to a woman I know.
And who is that woman?
Her name is Katherine.
She spent the night here last week.
You took a box cutter from me.
You loaned it to me.
Checks out. He was in Darien last night.
He was in prison for assault.
He was in prison. He shouldn't be in New York.
He's been in her house. He must have met her.
Her earring is beside his bed and he borrowed a knife from me,
translation.ko: 제인의 귀고리가 침대 옆에 있고 나한테 칼도 빌려 갔고 감옥에도 갔었어요

translation.en: and he's been in prison.
translation.ko: 나한테 칼도 빌려 갔고 감옥에도 갔었어요

translation.en: And he was fired from his job.
His assistant died.
He threatened me. In my home.
He beats his child.
I'm a child psychologist.
I know how to identify a child who's in danger, who's being abused.
And I saw Alistair slap Ethan in my home yesterday.
translation.ko: 어제 여기서 이선의 뺨을 때리는 걸 봤어요

translation.en: Wait-- W--
Yes, yes. Yesterday.
I see…
I see the way that you're all looking at me.
I'm not crazy.
I'm not hallucinating. Do I seem unreasonable?
I have evidence.
There was that picture that Jane drew and she signed,
and there's a photograph that somebody took of me while I was sleeping.
translation.ko: 잠들어 있을 때 누가 날 찍은 사진도 있고

translation.en: Look, it doesn't matter what you think about me,
if you approve of me, if you think that I'm reliable.
There is a boy in danger in that house.
translation.ko: 저 집에 위험에 처한 아이가 있어요

translation.en: Just help him, please.
You're a father. I…
I would think that you would want to help a child.
If my husband were here…
he would help.
He would believe me.
[Norelli] Dr. Fox, your family is dead.
I don't know how you can live with yourself
if you let something happen to a child.
translation.ko: 어떻게 마음 편히 살 수 있어요?

translation.en: [Norelli] I'm sorry, but your family is dead.
Do you like the mountains, Livy?
[Olivia] They look like a giant's bed.
Like a giant, sleeping under a white blanket.
translation.ko: 거인이 하얀 담요를 덮고 자는 거 같아

translation.en: [Anna] You're gonna ski in those tomorrow.
That one looks like a horse.
What would you name a horse if we got one?
I'd call him Vixen.
A vixen is a fox.
It's a girl fox, sweetheart.
[Olivia] What would you call a horse, Mommy? "Of course, of course."
translation.ko: - 엄마는 무슨 이름 붙일 거야? - '그렇지, 그렇지'

translation.en: It's an old TV show.
I can't do it this way.
Do what?
Do what?
This.
This happy family vacation.
You and I spoke in painful detail
and I thought that we agreed that we would not ruin Christmas.
And I can't do it anymore. I can't.
The acting is foolish. It doesn't dignify our daughter.
translation.ko: 연기해 봐야 뭐해 우리 딸을 무시하는 거야

translation.en: You don't care if she gets upset?
She should be upset. It's upsetting.
Well, don't blame me if she's scarred for life.
translation.ko: 평생 상처가 돼도 날 탓하지 마

translation.en: I do blame you. You're to blame.
The one fucking the other person is to blame.
You wanna answer it?
I bet that's him.
I'll answer it.
-Stop it! -Stop it!
-[man] Anna! -[gasps]
I'm sorry, but… your family is dead.
Ed? Ed! [exclaims]
Livy?
Livy?
[sniffles] Olivia?
Come on, baby. [sniffles]
I got you. Come on.
Olivia.
Wake up. [sniffling] Wake up!
-[call failure tone] -[signal beeping]
[Little] I talked to your doctor, Dr. Landy.
And you have had a hell of a time.
And I think you actually believe that you met this lady
just like how you believe you're talking to your family.
translation.ko: 가족과 통화하고 있다고 믿는 것과 비슷해요

translation.en: Your doctor said that your meds can cause hallucinations.
translation.ko: 그 약에 환각 부작용이 있을 수 있다더군요

translation.en: Maybe that's okay by you.
[scoffs] I know it'd be okay by me.
-Jane Russell… -Yeah, she, uh… -She checks out. -[Jane 2 sighs]
This lady here, from 101…
she is who she says she is.
She is Jane Russell.
-Now, as for what you saw that night-- -Um…
I'm so, so sorry.
Of course. Your wife is who she says she is.
Of course she is.
Of course… you are.
I'm really sorry that I involved you in… all of this.
translation.ko: 이런 소동에 끌어들여서 정말 죄송해요, 전…

translation.en: I'm so sorry that I mixed Ethan up in this.
translation.ko: 이선을 이런 일에 끌어들인 것도 죄송하고

translation.en: I don't… I don't know…
what you must think.
All of you.
I understand…
if you want to recommend…
translation.ko: 누군가가 곁에 있어야 한다고 권고하실 수도 있겠죠

translation.en: supervision.
[Karl] I'm listening.
I've been slipping.
Slipping on my meds.
Drinking.
Getting into a really…
dark frame of mind and I'm not sharing that with you.
translation.ko: 어두운 생각만 드는데 말하고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: [Karl] That's a hard thing to admit.
And to hear.
I don't think that the Elevan is good for me. [chuckles softly]
translation.ko: 엘리밴이 저한테 안 좋은 거 같아요

translation.en: -[laughs] No. -Not if you're hallucinating, no.
translation.ko: - 네 - 환각이 보인다면 안 좋은 거죠

translation.en: I wouldn't think, no, no. [sniffles]
And there's some mania… too.
I just really needed to be at the center of something.
I needed a wake-up call.
You got very lucky with that detective.
You realize how this could've gone differently.
I just wanna turn it around.
I had no idea about David.
Well, that was a mess.
-Is he here? -No, no.
He's… gonna come back this afternoon and…
pick up the last of his stuff.
Which leaves you here alone.
You don't think it's paranoid if I wanna change the locks, do you?
translation.ko: 자물쇠 바꾸려는 게 유난스러운 건 아니겠죠?

translation.en: There's gonna have to be somebody here.
And then you and I are gonna go back to three sessions a week.
Okay.
I'm Anna Fox.
Uh, today is, um…
Monday. November 6th.
And I'm making this video…
[whispers] Making…
I'm Anna Fox, and I'm at 104…
translation.ko: 이름은 애나 폭스고 뉴욕 맨해튼 웨스트 121번가 104번지에 살아요

translation.en: West 121st Street in Manhattan, New York.
And I am, uh, making this video…
as my final will and testament.
Randy Turo, that's a lawyer.
He has a written will…
that Ed and I did together.
After, um… Olivia was born.
And I'm not gonna be… making any, like, super-significant changes…
translation.ko: 완전 중요한 변경을 하려는 건 아니고

translation.en: Super… Super…
-Fuck, really? -[camera beeps]
The point of me doing this is that there's no, um…
confusion…
about, um, my soundness of mind.
My state of mind.
I-- I-- I especially wanna make sure that, um…
that you know that David Winters has absolutely nothing to do with my death.
translation.ko: 데이비드 윈터스는 내 죽음과 아무런 관련이 없어요

translation.en: In fact, I'm waiting for him to come…
to come and to get his stuff…
so that I can, um…
go through with it.
Go through with it… [scoffs]
I just wish I could be forgiven.
I really… wish I could just be forgiven.
I want to go back.
I want to do it over.
I want to do it different.
And I can't.
And I can't.
[shouts] I can't!
-[Anna] Punch. -[camera clicks]
-Punch. Punch. -[camera clicking]
[whispering] Okay.
Hello?
Hello?
[David] Sorry.
Tried to call. I just need to get my umbrella and my gloves.
translation.ko: 미안해요, 전화를 안 받길래요 우산이랑 장갑만 챙겨 갈게요

translation.en: [Anna] Can you come up? Uh, just for a moment.
[David] I'm soaking wet.
I had a long day and it's not about to end soon.
[Anna] Please. It'll just take a minute.
Thank you.
I wanna show you… a picture.
The face in the wine glass.
Yeah, I see it.
That is the woman that I saw murdered.
She said that her name was Jane Russell!
Her name is Katie.
What?
Ethan, the son…
she is the birth mother.
You spent the night with her.
Wednesday. One night.
She was a total disaster. Why do you think I bailed?
I spent the night on a couch in Astoria on Thursday night
just so I don't have to run into her again.
She ran away on him when she was eight months pregnant.
Disappeared. Alistair spent two years chasing her down
and found her in some Oregon meth commune. He took the boy, she went to prison.
translation.ko: 오리건의 마약 굴에서 찾아내 애를 데려왔고 여자는 감옥에 갔죠

translation.en: -See how I changed the subject on you? -I did.
You don't know who you're fooling with. [laughing]
They told you this?
She did. She wouldn't shut up.
translation.ko: - 저 부부가 말해줬어요? - 케이티가요 지겹게 떠들어댔어요

translation.en: They've been hiding from her for years. She found out they were living in Boston.
translation.ko: 저 집은 몇 년째 피해 다니다가 보스턴에서 들켜서 찾아오지 말라고 돈을 주고 있었죠

translation.en: He's been paying her to stay away.
translation.ko: 보스턴에서 들켜서 찾아오지 말라고 돈을 주고 있었죠

translation.en: Why did she tell me her name is Jane Russell?
You're Jane Russell. You're Jane Russell.
What makes you say that?
[Anna] Your son came by. Ethan.
I saw her murdered.
Whatever you say, Anna.
Yeah.
I showed you… the picture.
Yeah, looking very much alive.
She's real!
And I need you to go to the police with me.
No. No, no.
David! You can't just run away from this!
[David] Watch me. Oh, shit! Please, David!
-[glass shatters] -Oh, shit!
David?
Oh, my God!
You know what's so great about this?
Everyone thinks I'm in New Hampshire right now.
translation.ko: 다들 내가 뉴햄프셔에 있는 줄 알아요

translation.en: They call it a wilderness program but it's really a prison.
I was supposed to go last month but they had a fire or something. [chuckles softly]
We never had a chance to say goodbye.
translation.ko: 우리 그때 작별 인사도 못 했죠?

translation.en: David!
The trick is to run away before you get there.
What did you do? [loudly] David!
He's dead. You killed him.
-No. What? -It's your knife.
translation.ko: 아니야, 뭐? 당신 칼이에요, 당신 집이고 단둘이 있었어요

translation.en: Your house. Just the two of you.
translation.ko: 당신 칼이에요, 당신 집이고 단둘이 있었어요

translation.en: What did you do?
He deserved it.
He slept with my mom and got her all pissed off. And then threw her out.
translation.ko: 우리 엄마랑 자고서 열받게 해놓고 쫓아냈어요

translation.en: She might have just gone away if he'd left her alone.
Then maybe none of this would have happened.
-Don't scream, Anna. -[gasps]
That'll just be bad for everyone.
Take a deep breath.
That's what they're always telling me to do.
Self-management coping skills.
Good. We can breathe together.
-Why are you so freaked out? -[shuddering]
You're killing yourself anyway, right?
No. No.
I thought it was a really nice video.
How did you get into my house?
'Cause you're so vigilant about your keys.
And sober. Right.
I've been in here all week.
You killed your mother.
That bothers you, right?
You feel for her?
You and Katie… one job to do.
translation.ko: 당신과 케이티는 할 일이 하나 있었어요

translation.en: One fucking thing.
Take care of your family, right?
Both of you.
And what do you do?
The real estate lady who sold my dad the house,
translation.ko: 우리한테 저 집 판 부동산 아줌마가 당신 얘길 해줬어요

translation.en: she talked about you and what happened.
translation.ko: 우리한테 저 집 판 부동산 아줌마가 당신 얘길 해줬어요 무슨 일이 있었는지

translation.en: And I couldn't stop thinking what a perfect next person you were for me.
translation.ko: 그걸 듣고 나니까 내 다음 여자로 딱 좋겠더라고요

translation.en: I knew exactly what you would like.
Is that a talent or a skill… to know that…
in your professional opinion?
Okay, see? Now you don't like me anymore.
Is that what happened in Boston
with you and Pam? She got sick of you?
translation.ko: 보스턴에서도 그렇게 된 거지? 팸이 너한테 정이 떨어진 거야?

translation.en: Pam liked everything I did.
translation.ko: 팸은 내가 뭘 해도 좋아해 줬어요

translation.en: You don't seem very sure about it.
She was just a place to start.
I'm still figuring things out.
-What does that mean? -I don't have a pattern yet.
translation.ko: - 무슨 뜻이야? - 난 아직 패턴이 없어요

translation.en: -Pattern of? -Of this!
I have so many choices, right?
What do I wanna be when I grow up?
I know I like being there when it happens, feeling it.
translation.ko: 난 일이 벌어지는 순간 옆에서 느끼는 게 좋아요

translation.en: Pam took about five minutes to die after she hit the ground.
If you hadn't found that picture of Katie,
I was just gonna come in at the very end and say goodbye.
translation.ko: 숨넘어갈 때 와서 작별 인사나 하려고 했어요

translation.en: You could pretend that I'm not even here.
translation.ko: 날 못 본 척 가도 되잖아요

translation.en: I just wanna watch you go.
Okay.
You know what, fuck it.
You wanna watch?
Because a world with you in it…
where you exist…
is a world of filth.
No, I'm done.
I don't wanna breathe that air.
-[Ethan] Anna! -[gasping heavily]
Anna!
Stop fighting me!
-[gasps] -You don't even wanna live anymore!
You haven't wanted to live for a long time!
Here we go!
[Anna] No!
[Little] Hey.
Hey, I was just gonna leave a message.
Were you here before?
[Little] Yeah. And they, um… they told me not to wake you, so…
Are you in pain?
I should be, right?
Hey, just don't stay on that shit too long 'cause it feels way too good.
translation.ko: 기분 좋다고 진통제 오래 맞지 마세요

translation.en: David's dead?
Yeah.
I'm sorry.
But, uh, we have the Russells in custody.
He isn't sayin' a word, but Jane, she won't stop talking, so… [scoffs]
translation.ko: 남편은 입을 다무는데 제인이 계속 떠들어서

translation.en: We have Katherine Melli's body.
We found it in Fort Lee.
Means you were right about everything you saw.
translation.ko: 당신이 봤던 게 다 사실이었던 거죠

translation.en: And we messed up, and you're gonna get a lot of apologies from a lot of people.
translation.ko: 앞으로 여러 사람들이 미안하다고 할 텐데

translation.en: And I just wanted to be here to be the first.
I'm sorry.
Thank you.
I saw your video.
So, look, um, Detective Norelli,
I hope you don't mind, she's got Punch at her house.
Whenever you're ready to get out of here, she's happy to give her back--
So, everybody's seen the video?
At this point…
no.
No, no, no. Um…
We're actually having a little trouble locating the phone.
Yeah, I think that somehow the phone ended up here with you,
translation.ko: 근데 알고 보니까 박사님이 갖고 계셨고

translation.en: and when I come back and ask you about it in an hour…
translation.ko: 한 시간 후에 제가 다시 오면

translation.en: you hand it over.
Get rid of anything on there that you don't want out, okay?
Really?
Look, I messed up this case so bad already.
I don't think one more thing is gonna hurt me, right?
Just be straight up with me.
I'm not gonna have to worry about you, right?
translation.ko: 이제 걱정 안 해도 되는 거죠?

translation.en: Right.
I have to go now.
I miss you.
You ready?
-[meows] -All right.
Okay, it won't be long. -Come on, come on. Come. -[purrs]
Good boy.
